title: How to Feather Edges on GIMP

steps.title: Click “File”, then “Open” to open the file navigator.
steps.content: Click “File”, then “Open” to open the file navigator.

steps.title: Select your file by clicking on it (it will be highlighted blue when selected).
steps.content: Select your file by clicking on it (it will be highlighted blue when selected). Click “Open”.

steps.title: Click “Add Alpha Channel”.
steps.content: Click “Add Alpha Channel”. Adding an alpha channel adds the ability to become transparent to your image.

steps.title: In the layers toolbox, hover over your image and right click.
steps.content: In the layers toolbox, hover over your image and right click.

steps.title: Click “Add.”
steps.content: Click “Add.” White (full opacity) should be selected.

steps.title: Click and drag from where you want your fade to end, to where you want your fade to begin.
steps.content: Click and drag from where you want your fade to end, to where you want your fade to begin. Don’t like how you fade looks? Simply hit Ctrl +z (on OSX) or Ctrl +z (on Windows) to undo your last step and try again! The fade you establish will run along the length of the page, perpendicular to the line you drag. Hold ⌘ Cmd (on OSX) or Ctrl (on Windows) while dragging to make your line automatically stick to set angles, making a perfectly vertical or horizontal line easier.

steps.title: Name your new faded image, and add the .png extension in place of any other extension.
steps.content: Name your new faded image, and add the .png extension in place of any other extension.

steps.title: Click “Export”, or simply hit the ↵ Enter key.
steps.content: Click “Export”, or simply hit the ↵ Enter key.
